properties.areaDesc: San Francisco River Valley; Chuska Mountains; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Plateau
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 5:51PM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...COLDER TEMPERATURES, MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW, AND WINDY
CONDITIONS TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...

.A potent winter storm will overtake New Mexico tonight through
Tuesday night when many northern and central areas of the state
can expect moderate to heavy snowfall and colder temperatures. In
addition, periods of strong and gusty winds will create areas of
blowing snow in central New Mexico focusing through the middle Rio
Grande Valley from Santa Fe to Albuquerque to Socorro. Residents
and travelers through much of northern and central New Mexico can
expect significant travel impacts tonight through Tuesday night.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches,
with locally higher amounts across the Chuska mountains.

* WHERE...Northwest Plateau, Chuska Mountains, San Francisco
River Valley, Lower Rio Grande Valley and San Agustin Plains
and Adjacent Lowlands.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and periods of low
visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY
